intro: Taraxacum dasypodum, commonly known as the woolly dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, bristly stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces a yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed head, typical of the dandelion genus. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Taraxacum dasypodum is a perennial plant that thrives in temperate climates and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
